channel.title: Games similar to World of Warcraft, but free?
channel.description:
Are there any? I've tried Runes of Magic, but I didn't really like the UI.
Have any of you tried any of them? I'm just looking for a new MMORPG to play alongside RS :P

item.title: Games similar to World of Warcraft, but free?
item.dc:creator: @Aetoc Aetoc
item.description:
@Aetoc wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:21, topic:450473”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=553357.msg4057474#msg4057474 date=1343105936]
Everquest 2
[/quote][/quote]

Only game i can play that satisfies my community needs, and my grandfather is a Game Master so that’s just a plus. It really is a good game though, so much questing and overall content to never get you bored and a very mature community of players that work together and help each other.

Read full topic

item.source: Games similar to World of Warcraft, but free?

item.title: Games similar to World of Warcraft, but free?
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

Me and my sister’s dad play a game called Fiesta. It’s free, and it’s pretty fun. You go around doing quests or tasks from villagers around the town. The max level is like 115. You pick different classes of what you want to be like a warrior.

There’s also another game me and my brother play called Realm of the Mad God. It’s a 2d game made in flash. The max level is 20 and it’s very easy to level up. You run around killing monsters in different realms and then you can go to the god lands and get rare items like potions to increase your stats permanently (except if you die). You can be like 15 different classes more or less, such as a ranger, mage, warrior, priest, paladin, knight, rouge, assassin, and more. It’s also free, the only thing you pay cash for is these tokens that you can buy different color clothes for your character but you lose them if you die, and you can buy more vaults to store items which only store 8 items each, and more character slots.

Both are for the most part free, and they are very fun. Try them.

Read full topic

item.title: Games similar to World of Warcraft, but free?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

I can only play wow for 1-3 months at a time before being brunt out and not playing or playing for the next 3 months

And no, good luck. Your best bet is a wow private server. I used to play bloodcraft back before I played real wow, had about 1.5k players and no donator items and everything was x1 blizzlike, but its died.
